result.execSummary:
The defendant Deondre Brooks Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deondre Brooks Stewart

defendant.name: Stewart, Deondre Brooks
defendant.address: 5516 North Long Island Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53209

records.addlTxt: Defendant Deondre Brooks Stewart in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Deondre Brooks Stewart.  Attorney Katrina Voge in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defendant prepared to enter a change of plea. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement. Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court orders Defendant to pay a fine in the amount of $500.00, plus mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA). Court waived payment of all non-mandatory costs, fees, and assessments due to inability to pay. Fees and fine to be paid by 6-11-2023 or civil judgment for failure to pay.

Defendant Deondre Brooks Stewart not in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson appeared by video for Deondre Brooks Stewart.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Pretrial conference held.  Defendant will be getting a TAD evaluation and Atty. Carson requests a status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deondre Brooks Stewart in court.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 1.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 085142,
Payable Number: 1027890,
Receipt Number: 22RP034077,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/30/22 @ 1:30p
